comments.body: is the show_blob_cors necessary? why return it by default? we add flag  for show credentials like connection_string for security concern, although weak. but is cors info something need special flag?

My thought is getting the blob cors setting needs another API call (coming table/queue/file may need one API call for each), which will cause a lot of network overhead when listing resources in a resource group or subscription. So I make this as an option to let user explicitly get the CORS setting.
Move to the L416's dict construct is OK, no need another conditional check

If we move it into the dict construct, there will be an empty field in the results like `key: ""` if `I(show_connection_string=false)`. There is a check in the function `self.format_endpoint_dict` to check whether the account_key is empty or not. If it is empty, the results will not contain the `connection_string`. So, is it ok to move it into the dict construction?
IMO, we can move the `get_connection_string` and construct the endpoints to one conditional check `if self.show_connection_string`.
